fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence sidebar, when the instance has many shortcuts it can be beneficial for the users to group those shortcuts.

h3. Why is this important
An instance with too many shortcuts can be to cumbersome to navigate. Also, grouping of them can help better identify the shortcut real objective.

h3. Suggested solution
Allow the creation of "folders" or groups of shortcuts

h3. Workaround
none
fields.summary: Enable grouping of Space Shortcuts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you hover your mouse over the People logo it should display a tooltip saying "People Directory" or at least "People", same as when you hover your mouse over the Confluence logo on the sidebar it shows a tooltip saying "Confluence".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the People page
# Hover the mouse over the icon on the left side bar

h3. Expected Results
A tooltip should appear saying "People"
h3. Actual Results
Nothing is displayed.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: The People logo should display its name in a tooltip

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not possible to download / preview attachments in iOS Mobile Confluence app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment (non-image) to a Confluence page
# Using the Confluence Cloud mobile app for iOS, open the same page
# Tap the attachment

*Update: The user will be able to preview/download the file in case:*
- The user has permission to Add attachments on the Space.
- The page doesn't have edit restrictions, or the user is part of the edit restrictions group (it doesn't matter if the user has the add pages permission on the Space). 

h3. Expected Results
The attachment should open and you should have an option to preview, open it with a different app and/or save it.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
If you tap and hold it, you are redirected to the browser version of Confluence Cloud.
There, if you login, you can see the file and then, by clicking at the share button, you can select to open with a different app and/or save it.

Another workaround would be to grant the user add attachments permission, and also include the user on the edit restrictions (if applicable).
fields.summary: Not possible to download attachments in iOS Mobile Confluence app

fields.description:
h3. Description
Fabric Decision Macros don't render in the Confluence Android App 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page with a decision macro in the Confluence Android App

h3. Expected Results
Macro renders
h3. Actual Results
In  View mode an item with a Bullet is shown; in Editor mode, a hexadecimal string is shown instead of the macro. Attempting to publish the page after opening it  yields the following error "Validation failure when converting format"

Use the Mobile device's browser and request desktop version.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira gadgets placed on a page using the new editor are not being correctly rendered, being cut and not displaying all information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a page with the new editor
# Insert some columns
# Add some Jira gadgets, one for each column and set them to auto width
(i) I was able to replicate it with the *Filter Results* and *Pie Chart*
# Configure the gadgets and publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The gadgets should be rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
They're being cut, as shown below:
|  !Screen Shot 2019-05-16 at 19.09.00.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Notes
* Sometimes it loads correctly, but most of the times it doesn't.
* On the screenshot attached table w/ Jira items should have three rows, not two. Third one is hidden due to rendering issue.
* I was able to reproduce the issue without adding columns, by simply inserting two "Filter Results" gadgets, the second one will be cut.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Gadgets are not being displayed correctly on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we use the Office Word macro, some performance issues can be faced while rendering the page - and sometimes it doesn't load at all.
This situation occurs with frequency when you are transitioning from a page to another one.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Both editing experiences

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a space which contains at least one page under the overview;
# Create a page or edit an existing one - no matter which editor version;
# Add a .docx file;
# Call the Office Word macro;
# Publish the page.

*Scenario A*:
* Go to another page under the same space;
* Once it is completely loaded, go back to the one you just added the .docx file.

On this scenario, you can face the issue with a certain frequency.

*Scenario B*:
* Try to access the page you added the .docx file through its link.

On this other scenario, the issue doesn't happen too much.

h3. Expected Results
*Scenario A*: the transition from a page to the one which is the file is regular, loading the page with the embedded file correctly and in an acceptable time range.

*Scenario B*: you are able to access the page without face any issues while loading the page.

h3. Actual Results
*Scenario A*: 
* Sometimes the loading wheel keeps spinning forever and the document doesn't load;
* Sometimes the loading wheel disappears and the document is not loaded;
* Sometimes it just takes too long to load the document.

*Scenario B*: Same as scenario A, but without too much frequency.

h3. Notes
* The new editing experience seems to reduce this performance situation.

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page helps to get the page rendered.
fields.summary: Rendering performance with Office Word macro

fields.description:

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Text within an Excerpt macro is displayed as smaller than the text on the rest of the page. This is the case both in the editor and when viewing a published page. There is no way to manually set font size for "normal text" which makes it impossible to fix this issue.

h2. Environment
Confluence Cloud + New (fabric) editor

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page and add text
# Add an Excerpt macro and fill with additional text
# Publish and observe the difference in font size

h2. Expected result
The text within the Excerpt macro is displayed with the same font size as the rest of the page text.

h2. Actual result
The text within the Excerpt macro is displayed as smaller than the rest of the page text. See screenshot:
 !JPPP Issue Store - Jira Platform Development - Confluence 2019-05-16 10-32-53.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
There are no workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: Font for excerpt doesn't match body text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The real page ID is currently available in the soon to be deprecated SOAP APIs. The {{/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id\}/version}} is the REST API replacement, however it does not return the real page id (content id) of the historical version of the page which makes it impossible to remove the version of the page via the REST API. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: getPageHistory on /wiki/rest/api/content/{id}/version does not provide the real page ID

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
{{getWatchersForSpace}} is currently available in the soon to be deprecated SOAP APIs. The recommended workaround is to use {{/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id\}/notification}} however this does not work as documented with either using the space id or space key. 

REST API documentation is here -> https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-notification-created-get

h3. Workaround
Currently there  is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: getWatchersForSpace, removeSpaceWatch, watchSpace on /wiki/rest/api/content/{id}/notification does not work as documented with either using the space id or the space key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The functionality to modify space permisssions at any time is currently available in the soon to be deprecated SOAP API. The {{/wiki/rest/api/space/\{spaceKey\}}} was provided as an alternative to the SOAP API, however, it only allows you to set space permissions when a space is created and not modify space permissions at any time. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. We are investigating if a workaround may be provided.
fields.summary: Add/Remove PermissionsToSpace on /wiki/rest/api/space/{spacKey} only allows you to set permissions when the space is created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary While attaching images of the same height and width, placing some text beside it creates identated alignment for the images if both are left aligned. h3. Environment * Confluence Cloud * Images h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page and insert an image1 # Write some random text beside it. # Insert another image2 in the next line having the same dimension. h3. Expected Results It shouldn't show those extra spacing between the images h3. Actual Results It does show spacing as attached. h3. Notes The storage format as follows:{code}

1Password

Password manager. It can also generate passwords for oneself and it even allows password sharing when a case arises!

Slack

For many, it is the primary form of communication for internal use. Slack utilizes different methods of quick communication for different situations.


{code} h3. Workaround The second image can be right aligned to ensure we don't run into this issue.
fields.summary: Attaching images of the same dimension alongwith text indentes with respect to first image

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the attachments are uploaded and unchecking the *Notify watchers* doesn't send any notifications. However, if those images are *copy & paste* then still without checking the Notify watcher option does still trigger the notification to the watchers stating an image is added to the page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add some test users as watchers of it.
# Then, go to the page and click on "Edit" and then click on "attachments"
# Attach a file to the page and uncheck *Notify watchers*, publish the page.
# Re-edit the page and then copy & paste another image.
# Uncheck *Notify watchers* and publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
There shouldn't be any notifications informing any updates to the customer.

h3. Actual Results
It does send notifications as per the attached screenshot
fields.summary: Copy & Paste an Image to a Confluence page and unchecking "Notify Watchers" still notifies watchers

fields.description: h3. Pages with Colored Links are not migrated to the new editor h3. Environment Confluence Cloud Migration between Old and New Editor h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page # Insert a link # Select the link # Click the *A* button in the toolbar to change its color # Pick any color # Save the page - note that the color will +not+ appear in the Edit mode. Only when previewing/viewing the published page # After migrating from old editor to new, check the page h3. Expected Results The page should be migrated to the new editor h3. Actual Results The page remains in the old editor. In some cases, the page loads in the new editor, but once published, it displays 'Unsupported Content' instead. h3. Notes You can identify that by the following pattern in the page's storage format: {code} Google {code} h3. Workaround # Edit the page # Remove the colored links # Publish it again (This will still load the page in the old editor) # Edit it once more # Publish it again In case it's displaying 'Unsupported Content', please [reach Atlassian Support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/] to remove the links manually.
fields.summary: Pages with Colored Links are not migrated to the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Heat Map macro, the preview doesn't load. If you add the macro and went to edit it, the macro just changes to the Activity Stream macro.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the new editing experience editor;
# call for the Heat Map macro (/heat);
# The pop-up of this macro will appear and the preview will not load but click o Save anyway;
# Go to edit the Heat Map macro, it is now changed to the Activity Stream one.

h3. Expected Results
Adding the Heat Map macro, it loads the preview of the content and you are able to add it in your page.

h3. Actual Results
The preview content is not shown in the macro pop-up window and it seems that Confluence calls for the Activity Stream macro if you save and go to edit it.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Heat Map macro changing to Activity Stream
Attachments disappears from Fabric due to asynchronous nature of media upload.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting a block link to an internal page in the New Editor, the link is automatically converted to a Smart Card Link. 

When clicking on this link in view mode, the link is opened in a new window or tab. There is no way to prevent this behavior and default to opening in the same tab.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a link into a page which points to an internal page. Do not select any text when doing so.
# A Smart Card Link is Created.
 !Screenshot 2019-05-15 at 11.59.16.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the page. View the page.
# Click on the newly created link.

h3. Expected Results
Page should open in same tab.

h3. Actual Results
Page is opened in new tab or window.

h3. Notes
This does not occur with inline links which are linked via text.

h3. Workaround
No workaround, as even when holding down CMD or CTRL still will open a new tab or window.
fields.summary: Opening block Smart Card Link opens in new tab or window

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When linking to an internal page in the New Editor in Confluence, it's not possible to find a page unless you have viewed it recently.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Confluence Cloud using a test user, or separate user from your main account.
 # Create a new page in Confluence with a unique title. Publish.
 # Logout, and login again as a new user (this can be your usual user.)
 # Create or Edit a page in Confluence using the New Editor.
 # Insert Link macro by typing {{/link}}
 # In the search dialogue, attempt to search for the name of the new page.
 # You will find that it only displays pages that have already been viewed.

h3. Expected Results

Page is found from the list of internal pages, and a link is inserted.

Example of screen when inserting a link. The only pages displayed will be recently viewed pages:
 !Screenshot 2019-05-15 at 11.12.57.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Page name is not found, and a link is unable to be inserted.
h3. Notes

When a link is successfully inserted to an internal page, a Smart Card Link is created.

Example:
 !Screenshot 2019-05-15 at 11.59.16.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Visit the page first, and then try linking to the page.
fields.summary: Unable to link to internal pages which have not been previously viewed

Thanks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Google Drive add-on, by Atlassian, is currently blocking access to files on Drive, saying:
"We can't open this document as XXXX"

 
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-14 at 14.58.49.png|thumbnail! 


This seems to have started after 10-May-2019, after the last add-on update.

h3. Environment
 * This seems to happen on new authentications. So revoking authentication from Google's side and then try to reproduce these steps below

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy either a Google Docs/Sheets link
 # Either paste the link directly into the page, or insert a macro by typying "/doc" ("{doc" on the old editor).

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

If your company uses G Suite, check if the 3rd-party apps are allowed.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The appearance of the Excerpt Include macro is wrong in both Edit and View mode. It is displayed correctly only in the macro preview when editing the macro details.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud with Fabric Editor

Steps to reproduce
 # Create page 1 and use the Excerpt macro
 # Publish page 1
 # Create page 2 and use the Excerpt Include macro to point to page 1
 # In preview mode when editing the Excerpt Include macro the content is displayed correctly
 # Publish page 2

h3. Expected Result

The content of the Excerpt Include macro is displayed exactly like in the macro preview, both in page Edit and View mode.
h3. Actual result

The content of the Excerpt Include macro is displayed incorrectly and in a much less "professional" manner.
 - Space key is included as a prefix in the displayed macro header, which looks weird
 - The macro header is not displayed as bold text
 - There is no space before or after the Excerpt Include macro, which makes subsequent macros display with zero pixel distance, which again looks very unprofessional

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Appearance of Excerpt Include macro is wrong in Edit and View mode

fields.description:
Some Shortcuts in Confluence don't work, or end up interfering with OS's own shortcuts

h3. Current Situation
* Some shortcuts in Confluence either don't work or interfere with OS shortcuts and may be disruptive when trying to use them. 
Two examples of these:
# *B* Shortcut - This should be the "Blog" shortcut, but currently when you hit "B" on the keyboard, but nothing happens.
# *Add row above (and below) shortcuts* - End up rotating the screen on Windows OS.

h3. Expected Results
# Shortcuts like *B* should work as they're a time saver. 
# Shortcuts should be varied and maybe something that does not interfere with user's OS.
fields.summary: Some Shortcuts in Confluence don't work

fields.description:
Click on the *'?'* button on the left panel > *Keyboard Shortcuts*

A list of shortcuts will be displayed, with a link *View All Shortcuts* (on the bottom of the pop-up windows). By clicking this link we're redirected to [Keyboard shortcuts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-confluence-cloud/keyboard-shortcuts-934720180.html]
h3. *Current Situation*

This page should contain a list with Confluence's keyboard shortcuts, with information on how to use them, however, it just mentions how to get the list of shortcuts from within Confluence itself. This documentation also contains:
{quote}We could give you a list here, but then you'd need to keep referring to this page.
{quote}
Which I don't think it's a good idea, on a page that is named *Keyboard shortcuts*.
h3. *Expected Results*

This Page should contain a list with application shortcuts, editor shortcuts, and markdown shortcuts into a single page.

This page should be like a central HUB for all shortcuts in Confluence, so when users click on *View All Shortcuts* they'd actually be redirected to a page that has useful information on those.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcuts documentation update

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Include Page macro displays content in legacy (old) editor style. It is also ignoring any page width settings (e.g. full-width, etc.)

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud with Fabric Editor

Steps to reproduce
# Create and publish the first page using the (new) Fabric Editor. Include some content that would be displayed differently in the legacy editor. *Examples:* A formatted table, with cell background color, status macros, etc.
# Create and publish a second page, also using the Fabric Editor, where you use the Include Page macro to include the first page. If you're testing that the macro honors the width settings, set the width of the page with the *Include Page macro* to _full-width_.

h3. Expected Result
The content of the first page is displayed on the second page in identical fashion, full-width and same formatting as on the first page.

h3. Actual Result
The content of the first page is displayed with formatting from the old Legacy editor (pre-Fabric Editor\), which means a different display of status macro and different table formatting. In some cases, the page will display as fixed-width instead of full-width.

h3. Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Include Page macro displays content in legacy editor style

fields.description:
h3.Summary 
Similar to CONFCLOUD-65414 and CONFCLOUD-57539 whereby both bugs reported an issue when user accessing URL from Knowledgebase anonymously *without* Atlassian account. However, this is happening when a customer accessing the knowledge base *with or without* an Atlassian Account.

h3. Steps to Reproduce (Jira Service Desk side)
# Create a Jira Service Desk project
# Go to the *Project Settings* and search for the *Knowledge Base* part (https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/KEY/confluence-kb)
# There, make sure to *Link to a Confluence space* on your application
# Still on the Project Settings, under the *Access* session, check the "*Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledge base articles with your customers.* part.
# Accessing the linked space from *Space Settings*  (*Space Tools > Permissions*) you should see a message related to "*Any active user can view this space*"

h3. Confluence (Scenario 1 without Atlassian Account)
# Create a portal-only customer and grant anonymous access on the space
# Access the URL directly from a portal only customer

h3.Confluence (Scenario 2 with Atlassian Account)
# Migrate portal only customer to Atlassian account following the guide from [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html#ManageJiraServiceDeskcustomeraccounts-HowcanIgivelicensestocustomersIwanttocollaboratewithintrueorConfluence?] *or*create an Atlassian account without application access for the customer. 
# Access the URl directly

h3.Expected Results
The content display for the unlicensed user

h3.Actual Results
Noticed the page from Confluence refresh on the *second* load and show a blank page. (Attached with testing video)


h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround for this behavior at the moment.
fields.summary: Accessing URL which allowed unlicensed access will result in a blank space

fields.description:
When creating some text on a web page that I wish to be clicked on to open another page (daughter I believe it is called), the process is quite tedious as it involves:
# Click edit, write the text
# Publish the page
# Create a new page (page to be linked to)
# Go back to the original page with the text, 
# Click edit, 
# Highlight the text, 
# Click link, find the page to link to and confirm and publish.

Suggestion:
A simpler way where a user can simply 
# Type the text they want to link to another page, 
# Highlight the text 
# Then click link to new page and then the new page automatically opens up and I can name it. 
# Then upon clicking publish I have the text linked and the new page already created in far less steps?

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary

Perhaps a scenario like this: someone opens a new blank page and then changes their mind about wanting that new page. The only two choices are selecting the top back arrow or by selecting Close at the bottom of the page. Either way, Confluence end up creating an empty draft page and store inside the database. The amount of empty draft can pile up over time, especially on the large user base. 

h3. Expected Behaviour
 * Confluence should not create empty draft pages (as no content was inserted into the page)

h3. Actual Behaviour
 * Confluence save the page as a draft (though it has no content or title)
fields.summary: Confluence should not save empty draft pages

When creating or editing a template in Confluence with the new editor (through the Global Templates and Blueprints, or, the space templates option), if the user inserts the column macro and keep it empty (or only one side of it) and save it, all the content will be removed when trying to edit it again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, go to *Settings > Global Templates and Blueprints*, or, in a space, tap *Settings > Content Tools > Templates*.
# There, make sure to create a new template
# While on the edit mode for the template, make sure to insert the *column*
# Keep it empty, or, make sure to only fill one of the sides from the same
# Insert more content on the page for a test purpose
# Save the template and *edit* it again.

h3. Expected Results

The template should have the created content saved.

h3. Actual Results

When coming back to edit, the template content is empty.

h3.Notes

Attached a video of the bug happening:

 [^templates.mov] 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Currently, the Confluence Powerpoint Macro only allows one to reference a slide number.

If this Macro added the ability to reference a Section Name, then the reference could be dynamic, in that changes in the number of slides, or inserting a new slide into the presentation, would not demand that you then updated all the slide numbers on the Confluence page.

We have a lot of references to Powerpoint because much of our initial content is generated in PPT before being sent off to a graphic artist to formalize, so not having this functionality adds a lot of maintenance time to Confluence pages, when there's a fix possible.
fields.summary: Lack of Dynamic Powerpoint Referencing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting [Jira issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] into Confluence pages, when the status of the same changes in Jira, it takes a while to have it reflected in Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Confluence instance connected to a Jira one. It can be connected to a different application (with different URL), or, simply add a Jira application to Confluence.
# Create a new issue in Jira.
# On a Confluence page, make sure to *edit* it and insert the *Jira Issues* macro
# While editing the macro, insert the key from the issue that you have created and publish the page.
# Change the status of the issue in Jira (I.E. from "Needs Verification" to "Open")
# Refresh the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue macro information should have the new status reflected on the Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results

The Jira issue macro takes a couple of minutes to reflect the new status.

h3. Notes

* On the table view (when adding multiple Jira issues to be displayed with a single JQL), using the *Refresh* button will update the status.
* On the *Issue links* count on the top of the page, the status is immediately reflected after refreshing the page.
* Even removing and re-inserting the Jira issue macro to the page will not have a new status reflected, meaning that the content itself from Jira is taking a bit of time to be reflected in Confluence.
* On the new editor, it takes around 8+ minutes to have the status updated.
* On the Legacy Editor, it takes around 12+ minutes to have the status updated.

h3. Workaround

Use the *Refresh* button on the bottom of the *table view* mode for the macro when retrieving multiple Jira issues. This option is not available for a single issue view.
fields.summary: Jira Issues macro status takes a long time to update

fields.description:
When adding a macro such as a roadmap, if a user inadvertently clicks the back or refresh button on their browser their work is lost.

Confluence should detect if changes have been made to the page being edited, and if so ask the user to confirm leaving the page and losing all changes.

Currently if the user navigates away from the page, all changes are lost.  This is especially frustrating when working with complex macros like the roadmap.
fields.summary: When entering macro items (like a Roadmap) do not allow users to leave page without confirmation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an anchor is placed at the top of the page, clicking on a link at the same page pointing to that anchor will not reach the top of the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert an anchor at the top of the page
 # Insert a good quantity of text so it can create a scrollbar
 # Insert a link to the anchor at the bottom of the page
 # Publish the page, scroll down and click on the link

h3. Expected Results

The page should be scrolled to the top and reach the anchor
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't reach the top, staying a little below the anchor's location
|[^anchor_position.mp4]|

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Anchor position is not reached when it's at the top of the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Recent spaces drop-down is hidden behind Confluence's most left pane (with Confluence's logo, Search and Add icons...)
h3. Environment
 * No spaces should be accessed - this way the "Recent Spaces" drop-down will be empty, besides for "All Spaces"
 * Whenever accessing a space or by refreshing the page while in a space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in with an user (or create a new one) that haven't navigated to any spaces (so no spaces are listed on "Recent spaces")
 # Navigate to a space, and once in the overview page click the space's name - this will trigger the "Recent Spaces" drop-down menu

h3. Expected Results
 * Drop-down menu to be displayed with no "Recent Spaces" and "All Spaces" link.
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 13.22.42.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 * The drop-down menu is hidden behind the main left panel, and this is indicated by a scrollbar appearing right next to the panel, where the drop-down should be
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 13.43.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

A quick solution for this case would be collapsing the sidebar, by either by hitting "*[*" on the keyboard or by clicking the "Collapse Button", and uncollapsing it. Once uncollapsed the drop-down will be displayed as expected
 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 13.52.30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Recent spaces drop-down is hidden behind Confluence's left pane

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to use the "Create from Template" macro from a template which was edited and that we added variables to it, the page is then created without the variables. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud - Old editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Content Tools* in a space
# Edit *Troubleshooting articles* template
# Add a variable for the *Category* field
# Save it
# In the same space, create a new page and add the *Create from Template* macro selecting the *Troubleshooting article* as "Template name" from the drop-down and then save the page
# Navigate to the view mode of the page and click on "Add troubleshooting article" (article title, it may differ)

h3. Expected Results
The page should be created using the template previously edited with the variables. 

h3. Actual Results
The page is created with the variables in blank. 

h3. Workaround
Create a new (not from the defaults ones) Blueprint/Template and add a variable.
fields.summary: Variables are blank when using Create from Template macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Warning macro isn't rendering properly after a page is published.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud - Old editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add sections and content within the page
# Add a warning macro somewhere in the page 
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The warning macro should render correctly. 

h3. Actual Results
It looks like its format breaks causing the following:

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Warning macro not rendering properly after the page is published

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Internal links (to other Confluence pages on the same instance) within Excerpt Include content are not displayed correctly when that page is exported to pdf or word.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud
Fabric Editor

Steps to reproduce
# Create the first page and let the page title include at least one special character. Eg. Use the Norwegian characters æ, ø and å. 
# Publish the first page
# Create a second page and add the Excerpt macro
# Enter text into Excerpt macro, including a link to the first page (step 1)
# Publish the second page
# Create the third page
# Insert the Excerpt Include macro and link to the excerpt from the second page (steps 3-5)
# Publish the third page
# Export the third page using either the "Export to pdf" or "Export to word" functions

h3. Expected Result
The link in the excerpt is displayed correctly with the link text in both the pdf and word file.

h3. Actual Result
The link to the page with special characters in the title (see step 1 above) displays the full URL instead of the link text. This renders the exported content unreadable. This puts severe limitations on using Confluence Cloud for Norwegian language content. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Links within Excerpt Include content not displayed correctly in pdf or word export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have a page with Page Properties Report macro and you resort the columns then export to PDF or Word, the page doesn't contain the new sorting.
The export takes into consideration the server default sorting and not the new server-side sorting.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Page Properties Report macro
 # Manually click the column header to sort
 # Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results

Page Properties Report macro to follow the sorting by the user on Pdf file.

h3. Actual Results

Page Properties Report macro does not respect the sorting done by user on Pdf file.



h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page Properties Report: allow client side sorting to be exported to PDF

On some fabric enabled sites the page title

 * Affects pages imported with CMAC from server.
 * Also affects cloud-to-cloud imports.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
On a Fabric (new) editor enabled site:

OR

Page titles are centred where as the body of the pages is full width and left aligned. 

 !Pages-on-site-1.png|thumbnail!    !Pages-after-import-on-site-2.png|thumbnail!

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, after uninstalling an add-on, the user must manually remove the macros from every page.


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to remove all related macros when uninstalling an add-on.


h3. Workaround
No workaround besides manually removing the macro.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have strings of text present on a page that are identical but one string is inside an excerpt macro with the 'Hide Excerpted Content' option enabled, you won't be able to create an inline comment on the other plain text string.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Insert an Excerpt macro
 # Inside the macro, enter a single word like 'Test'
 # Edit the Excerpt macro and enable 'Hide Excerpted Content'
 # Outside the macro, enter the same single word 'Test' on the body of the page
 # Publish the page
 # Highlight the word 'Test' and attempt to add an inline comment

h3. Expected Results

Inline comment is created successfully
h3. Actual Results

Inline comment fails. The following message is shown despite the highlighted plain text on the body of the page not being inside a macro.
{quote}We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Disabling the Hidden property on the excerpt macro allows for inline commenting on both the plain text on the page and the text inside the macro.
fields.summary: Text Inside Hidden Excerpt Macros Prevent Inline Comments on Identical Plain Text on the Page Body

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to insert the *Pie Chart* (or the *Created Vs Resolved*) macro/gadget in pages using the Legacy editor, the same will only display blank content in its preview, as the screenshot below:

!pie.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to edit/create a new page that will be using the legacy editor
# Use the *insert/+* menu, or the "{" shortcut to search for the *Pie Chart/Created vs Resolved* gadget/macro
# Notice how the preview will behave

h3. Expected Results

The macro(s)/gadget(s) configuration should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

No content is displayed on the preview option of the macro.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pie Chart and Created vs Resolved gadget/macro not working on Legacy Editor

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 18 April 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

We have been working to improve the code blocks experience and in regard to this ticket requests', we already shipped the following capabilities 1. Showing line numbers & 2. A handy *Copy* button, that could allow users to copy the content from this macro. We recommend for you to follow [this ticket |https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72003] for the rest of the requests. Meanwhile, for collapsing the code block, one workaround that could elevate some of the pain is to put code blocks [inside expands|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-expand-macro/].

Thanks,
Yousef

{panel}



Allow further customization of the "Code" macro in the new editor. The "Code" macro replaced "Code Block" macro, but it does not allow as many customization options as the macro it replaced.
h3. Current Situation

Currently, the "Code" macro replaced the "Code Block" macro in the new editor, but this new macro won't provide users with much customization options (just its width) as much as the old macro did. This includes:
* Change the background color (theme)
* Collapse
* Show line numbers
* A handy *Copy* button, that could allow users to copy the content from this macro;


h3. (!) Point of attention
It seems that this macro is not currently highlighting some languages, an example of this is "Shell" as can be seen in the next screenshot no syntax highlight is present in this simple line of code

!Screen Shot 2019-05-03 at 10.57.06.png|thumbnail!

*Additional Note*
Provide support for other languages too, e.g. MatLab
fields.summary: Allow further customization of the "Code" macro in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using any Office macro (Excel/Powerpoint/Word), in the mobile version the page keeps blank. It doesn't matter which is the operational system (Android or iOS).

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the editor;
# Attach an Office file (.doc/.ppt/.xls);
# Call the respective Office macro of your file;
# Publish the page;
# Go to the mobile app and open the page.

h3. Expected Results
The page is visible with the content, as it is in the browser version.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence app just shows a blank page.

h3. Notes
* Tried to install the Office apps in the smartphone and re-open the page, not successful;
* It is happening on Android and iOS systems;
* Doesn't matter which is the Confluence editor you are using.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Office Macros - Confluence mobile app issues

fields.description:

When using Confluence search, it's possible to search through existing questions in Confluence Questions. However, from this screen it's not possible to tell if a question has been answered.

From documentation:
 !image-2019-05-03-13-35-49-871.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way, such as a green checkmark (/) in order to tell a user if the question has been answered.
fields.summary: Ability to see if a question has been answered from Confluence Search

fields.description:
h3. Revoking access tokens in confluence cloud is throwing 500

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Try to revoke one of the existing connection tokens

You are able to remove it.

h3. Actual Results
You are not able to remove it.
 A pop-up saying "Error occurred while trying to revoke the access token"
 In the browser console, there's a 500 error in the following method:
{code:java}
/wiki/users/revokeoauthtokens.action
{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Blogposts new editor URL for linking purpose

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
!paste-list-into-list-item.gif!

additional cases, nested:
 * a 1
 * a 2
 ** b1
 ** b2
 *** c1
 *** c2
 ** b3
 ** b4

---- * target

 

select from b1 & b2 then paste

select from b1 until c2 then paste

The bullets paste correctly without adding an extra bullet

h3. Actual Results
An extra bullet is adding to the bullets.

h3. Workaround
Remove the entire content and start again.

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Currently, there wasn't an endpoint from [Confluence Cloud REST API documentation |https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/] to check for the installed plugin pricing on the current instance. We do have an endpoint to check for pricing from [Marketplace REST API,|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/rest#api-addons-addonKey-pricing-cloudOrServer-liveOrPending-get] which check for overall pricing for a specific plugin on our Marketplace. But it doesn't work in a way that allows customers to check installed plugin pricing.

h3.  Concerns from customer

* The purpose of having this functionality is to check for plugin upgrades. Since some plugin upgrades happened regularly. This will allow the customer to keep track of the current pricing and the cost that used for the plugin too.
fields.summary: Confluence REST API to keep track of plugin pricing

At present, the Widget Connector Macro for YouTube videos only works with long URLs, e.g [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k6lK5hlB1nQ].
